metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9984 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
The snd_msnd_interrupt function in sound/isa/msnd/msnd_pinnacle.c in the Linux kernel through 4.11.7 allows local users to cause a denial of service (over-boundary access) or possibly have unspecified other impact by changing the value of a message queue head pointer between two kernel reads of that value, aka a "double fetch" vulnerability. Pengfei Wang discovered that the Turtle Beach MultiSound audio device driver in the Linux kernel contained race conditions when fetching from the ring-buffer. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (infinite loop).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9984` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:
